required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Pharmacokinetics of Uprifosbuvir (MK-3682) and Ruzasvir (MK-8408) in Participants With Moderate and Severe Hepatic Insufficiency (MK-3682-029)
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part, Open-Label Study to Investigate the Single-Dose Pharmacokinetics of MK-3682 and MK-8408 When Coadministered to Subjects With Moderate and Severe Hepatic Insufficiency

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 2-part, non-randomized, open-label, single-dose study to evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of uprifosbuvir (MK-3682), its metabolites M5 and M6, and ruzasvir (MK-8408) in participants with moderate hepatic insufficiency (HI) (Part 1) and in participants with severe HI (Part 2) compared to those in matched healthy particpants.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-inf (Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve from Start of Dosing to Infinity after Single Dosing) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir
AUC0-last (Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve, from Start of Dosing to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Sample) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir
AUC0-24 (Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve, from 0 to 24 Hours after Dosing) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir
Cmax (Maximum Observed Plasma Drug Concentration after the Administration of a Given Dose) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir
C24 (Plasma Concentration at 24 Hours) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir
t1/2 ((apparent) terminal half-life) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir
CL/F (Apparent Clearance after extravascular administration) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir (as applicable)
Vz/F (Apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase after extravascular administration) after Administration of uprifosbuvir and ruzasvir (as applicable)

arm_group.description: On Day 1 of Part 1, participants will receive a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.
On Day 1 of Part 2, participants will receive a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

Following completion of enrollment of all participants with HI in Parts 1 and 2, participants with normal hepatic function will receive a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.
